results.title: Repurposing metformin, simvastatin and digoxin as a combination for targeted therapy for pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.

results.title: Statins exert anti-growth effects by suppressing YAP/TAZ expressions via JNK signal activation and eliminate the immune suppression by downregulating PD-L1 expression in pancreatic cancer.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ had an anti-proliferative effect on @<m>DISEASE_Pancreatic_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010190 @@@pancreatic cancer@@@ cells with decreased the @GENE_YAP1 @GENE_10413 @@@yes-associated protein@@@ (@GENE_YAP1 @GENE_10413 @@@YAP@@@)/PDZ-binding motif (@GENE_TAZ @GENE_6901 @@@TAZ@@@) expression by activating the @GENE_MAPK8 @GENE_5599 @@@JNK@@@ pathway, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment with @CHEMICAL_Oxaliplatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077150 @@@oxaliplatin@@@ revealed additive anti-growth effects.

results.title: Transcriptome sequencing analysis reveals unique and shared antitumor effects of three statins in pancreatic cancer
